SENT.plain: We report a case of a child with familial cardiomyopathy who contracted H1N1 influenza followed by cardiovascular collapse requiring immediate arteriovenous ECMO support
Despite the lack of experience with heart transplantation (HTx) soon after H1N1 infection, HTx was considered as an exit strategy since restoration of cardiac function was considered unlikely
In contrast to the most common indication for ECMO use in patients with H1N1 infection, early ECMO support in cases with infection-induced myocardial decompensation may be lifesaving

Additionally, this report shows that urgent heart transplantation in a patient on ECMO support can be performed safely after recent H1N1 infection and simultaneous heparin-induced thrombocytopenia, which has not been reported before
This case also indicates that H1N1 vaccination should be considered for potential transplantation candidates to prevent severe infection
